view

Class ToggleButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • view.Button
        • view.ToggleButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GUI.ViewSwitchButton

    public abstract class ToggleButton
extends Button
    Acts like a regular Button, except that if it gets clicked it will stay in a pressed mode rather than idle or mouseOver. Can add to a RadioButton to make it 'unpressed' again, which is the main reason for this class to exist. If this button is pressed and user clicks on another button that is added to the same radio button this button will become idle.
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToggleButton

        public ToggleButton(java.lang.String imageName,
            int posX,
            int posY,
            int width,
            int height)
        Initializes the button.
        Parameters:
        imageName - file name of the image. It will be stored as an AnimatedRenderable with 3 frames internally and the image itself should reflect that.
        posX - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        posY - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        width - width of the button
        height - height of the button

      • ToggleButton

        public ToggleButton(java.lang.String imageName,
            int posX,
            int posY,
            int width,
            int height,
            RadioButton parent)
        Initializes the button.
        Parameters:
        imageName - file name of the image. It will be stored as an AnimatedRenderable with 3 frames internally and the image itself should reflect that.
        posX - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        posY - position of the top left corner of the image representing the button
        width - width of the button
        height - height of the button
        parent - RadioButton that will handle this button's state based on what the user clicks on.

      • changeToggled

        public void changeToggled(boolean t)
        Toggles between button being pressed and idle. Used by radio button.
        Parameters:
        t - If true buttons becomes pressed, if false button becomes idle.

      • changeParentRadioButton

        public void changeParentRadioButton(RadioButton b)
        Adds RadioButton as a parent to this object.
        Parameters:
        b - Radio button will now handle pressed/idle states for this object
